meanings.definition: An entry recording a sum owed
meanings.sent1: I made a debit in my ledger for the money I owe.
meanings.sent2: The accountant recorded the debit in the financial statement.
meanings.sent3: The debit in my account made me realize I need to budget better.
meanings.sent4: The debit in my balance sheet highlighted my outstanding debts.
meanings.sent5: The debit in my records stood out as a reminder of my financial obligations.

meanings.definition: To remove money from an account
meanings.sent1: I need to debit $50 from my savings for the bill.
meanings.sent2: Remember to debit the correct amount when making a withdrawal.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally debited too much and now my account is empty.
meanings.sent4: She had to debit her account to pay for the unexpected expense.
meanings.sent5: The cashier will debit your account for the purchase you made.

meanings.sent1: The monthly debit for my car loan is due tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: I received a notification about the upcoming debit from my bank.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected debit caught me off guard this month.
meanings.sent4: The automatic debit for my subscription renewed without any issues.
meanings.sent5: I always check my bank statement for any unusual debits.
